summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2021-2023 between federal prosecutors (AUSAs from the Southern District of New York) and Manhattan District Attorney's Office prosecutors regarding a sexual abuse investigation involving Leon Black. The emails discuss coordination, scheduling calls, and the emergence of a new cooperating witness (CW) who alleges abuse by Black and was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Lauren Phillips
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial email in the chain on June 9, 2023, from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation discussed in the emails. A new cooperating witness alleges sexual abuse by him, and he is described as being investigated by both federal and state prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals (along with Jeffrey Epstein) who trafficked the new cooperating witness who has come forward with allegations against Leon Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals (along with Ghislaine Maxwell) who trafficked the new cooperating witness who has come forward with allegations against Leon Black.

connections.description: A new cooperating witness alleges sexual abuse by Leon Black and states she was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell (and Jeffrey Epstein).
A new cooperating witness alleges sexual abuse by Leon Black and states she was trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein (and Ghislaine Maxwell).
Both are mentioned together as the traffickers of the new cooperating witness in the Leon Black investigation.

events.title: Initial DA Inquiry to SDNY
events.description: Manhattan District Attorney's Office prosecutors reach out to the SDNY to coordinate regarding their separate investigation into sexual abuse allegations against Leon Black.

events.title: SDNY Updates DA on Investigation Status
events.description: An SDNY AUSA informs the Manhattan DA's office that they have no current plans to interview a victim and are not likely to open another investigation unless circumstances change.

events.title: New Cooperating Witness Emerges
events.description: SDNY prosecutors inform the Manhattan DA's office that a new cooperating witness (CW) has come forward alleging sexual abuse by Leon Black and that she was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: New York County District Attorney's Office
keyFacts: A new cooperating witness (CW) alleged sexual abuse by financier Leon Black in February 2023.
This new witness stated she was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, directly linking Black's alleged conduct to the Epstein-Maxwell sex trafficking operation.

Both the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Manhattan District Attorney's Office were conducting parallel investigations into sexual abuse allegations against Leon Black.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination and communication between federal and state prosecutors regarding the Leon Black investigation from 2021 to 2023.
The SDNY indicated in January 2022 that they were not likely to open a new investigation but were informed of a new witness in 2023.
